properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 3:49AM MST until February 20 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW OVER PORTIONS OF FAR NORTHEAST NEW
MEXICO TODAY, TONIGHT, AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING...

.As an upper level disturbance makes its way over the central
Rockies, periods of light snow will continue over the northern
mountains of New Mexico today. Daytime accumulations will
generally amount to an inch or two today; however a potent
backdoor cold front will invade northeastern New Mexico this
evening, leading to increased snowfall through the overnight
hours. Snow will then decrease in coverage and intensity through
the late morning Thursday.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches
with the highest amounts expected near the Colorado border.

* WHERE...Union County.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and periods of low
visibility.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY
